class_notes:
(Same as AMST 490W 1) 
(Senior seminar that serves as the capstone experience for both majors in the ILA. Three major components shape the seminar: 1) each student writes a significant portion of the senior interdisciplinary thesis and teaches their research to other students; 2) students look in depth at the history of disciplines and current debates in interdisciplinarity, referring to recent work by Alan Repko and Joe Moran, among others-; 3) students study a theme or text through an interdisciplinary lens. Assignments may include: 1) 20-25-page term paper that will become part of the AMST or IDS senior thesis; 2) teaching by the student of a class session; 3) a collaborative public scholarship project.)
course_description: IDS 491 senior seminar serves as the capstone experience for all each class of interdisciplinary undergraduate scholars. Students write and present a portion of their senior project, read contemporary debates about interdisciplinarity, and design a shared unit of interdisciplinary study.
